Is Cache expensive?

Cache, OK
StateOklahoma
Population2,842

Compared to its nearby areas, Cache is somewhat more expensive, and it is a lot less expensive compared to the entire country. However compared to the city of Oklahoma City, it is a bit less expensive.

Home prices

The median home in Cache costs $133,100. Compared to its surrounding areas this is approximately $8,240 (6%) higher.It is approximately $84,400 (38%) lower in comparison to the rest of the nation, and in comparison to the city of Oklahoma City it is roughly $25,400 (16%) lower.

Rents

The median rent in Cache is $725 per month. In comparison to its nearby areas it is approximately $133 (15%) lower.In comparison to the entire country it is approximately $337 (31%) lower, and in comparison to the city of Oklahoma City is roughly $146 (16%) lower.

Nearby places

Medicine Park

Medicine Park is approximately 9 miles northeast of Cache. The real estate prices there are substantially more expensive. The median home in Medicine Park costs $226,200, which is $93,100 (41%) higher than Cache. The rent there is somewhat more expensive. The median monthly rent in Medicine Park is $975, which is $250 (25%) higher than Cache.

Lawton

Lawton is about 9 miles east from Cache. The real estate prices there are somewhat less expensive. The median home value in Lawton is $112,800, which comes out to $20,300 (17%) lower than Cache. Rents there are a bit more expensive. In Lawton the median monthly rent is $832, which is $107 (12%) higher than Cache.

Faxon

Faxon is about 12 miles south of Cache. The housing prices there are fairly similar. The median home in Faxon is valued at $131,300, which comes out to $1,800 (1%) lower than Cache. Rent there is somewhat less expensive. The median monthly rent in Faxon is $663, which comes out to $62 (9%) lower than Cache.

Chattanooga

Chattanooga is about 15 miles south of Cache. Real estate prices there are substantially less expensive. The median home in Chattanooga costs $78,100, which is $55,000 (70%) lower than Cache. Its rents are a little more expensive. In Chattanooga the median rent is $1,054 per month, which is $329 (31%) higher than Cache.

Geronimo

Geronimo is approximately 15 miles southeast of Cache. The housing prices there are a lot less expensive. Geronimo's median home cost is $75,900, which is $57,200 (75%) lower than Cache. The rent there is a little more expensive. The median rent in Geronimo is $764 per month, which works out to $39 (5%) higher than Cache.
